alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Henderson; McLean; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 2:54AM EDT until August 07 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Spencer County in southwestern Indiana... Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky... Southeastern Henderson County in northwestern Kentucky... Northern McLean County in northwestern Kentucky... Northeastern Webster County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 245 AM CDT. * At 154 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Robards, or 10 miles southeast of Henderson, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Owensboro, Sebree, Whitesville, Robards, Masonville, Stanley, Knottsville, St. Joseph, Beech Grove, Moseleyville and Hebbardsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 60 and 70. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 133 and 146. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 2 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky.
